content:
Here is the list in the form of a hierarchy:

* Sentence:
	+ Clause (Independent or Dependent)
		- Phrase (Noun, Verb, Adjective, Adverb, Prepositional, Gerund, Infinitive)
			* Word (Noun, Verb, Adjective, Adverb)
				+ Letter

It's worth noting that this hierarchy is a simplification of the complex structure of language and there can be overlap between the different levels, and some elements can be omitted depending on the context. Additionally, a sentence can contain more than one clause, and a clause can contain more than one phrase, and a phrase can contain more than one word.
